entry.title: Re: Innovations in Master Data Governance with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Hi Anirban,

Thanks for your valuable feedback. Highly appreciated as always! Generally, the  Customer Influence program (https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3497)  continues to be a key driver in shaping MDG. The program is in full swing and managed by the development team. It also includes requests related to central governance across domains, mass processing, consolidation and process analytics. Development plans derived from the program and relevant to upcoming feature pack stacks are yet to be published.

Beyond customer influence, the evolvement of cloud-ready mode (e.g. feature/process scope, additional domains) is another key driver. Please check the SAP Roadmap Explorer for updates on a continued basis.

entry.title: SAP MDK: Disabling button while action is running
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to disable the sync button while the sync action is running. I've tried several things, but as off now I have this rule assigned to the onPress event of the button, but it seem to be doing nothing.

Can I have some help with this? Is there any other better or easier way to disable a button while an action is running?

export default function DisableDuringSync(clientAPI) {
    
    let button = clientAPI.getControlProxy();
    //let button = pageProxy.getControl('Button0'); // tu bot√≥n

    button.setEnabled(false);
    
    let deletePromise = clientAPI.executeAction("/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/SyncStartedMessage.action");

    return deletePromise
        .then((result) => {
            
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/UploadOffline.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/DownloadStartedMessage.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            return clientAPI.executeAction('/MovilRutas/Actions/Service/DownloadOffline.action');
        })
        .then((result) => {
            // Todas las acciones terminaron OK
            return button.setEnabled(true);
        })
        .catch(() => {
            // Si falla alguna, igualmente lo volvemos a habilitar
            return button.setEnabled(true);
        });
}

Regards

entry.title: Stay Current with SAP SuccessFactors Performance and Goal Management: 2H 2025 Updates
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Community!

The second half of 2025 has brought a wave of exciting enhancements to Performance Management and Goal Management (PMGM). SAP continues to refine the user experience, introduce AI-powered capabilities, and phase out legacy features. Whether you're an administrator, manager, or employee, these updates are designed to make your performance management journey smoother and more intuitive.

Let me walk you through the key highlights across Goal Management, Performance Management, Calibration, 360 Reviews, and Continuous Performance Management.

The 2H 2025 release demonstrates SAP's commitment to:

  1. Modernization: Phasing out legacy experiences in favor of streamlined, intuitive interfaces
  2. Automation: Reducing administrative burden through auto-activation and mass operations
  3. AI Integration: Expanding AI-assisted capabilities across more areas
  4. Flexibility: Providing granular controls for data management and retention
  5. Collaboration: Enhancing cross-functional feedback and activity sharing

Goal Management

1. Purge Goals by Goal ID

Administrators now have more granular control over data management. You can delete specific performance and development goals using their Goal IDs through the Data Retention Management tool. This enhancement provides precision when cleaning up historical data.

How to use it:

  • Navigate to Admin Center ‚Üí Data Retention Management
  • Select either "Purge Goal" or "Purge Development Goal"
  • Choose the "Purge by Goal ID" option
  • Download the template, fill in the Goal IDs, and upload to initiate the purge

What's Changed:
In the current version, the Purge method field lists two options for purging goals: "Purge by goal plan template" and "Purge by goal ID". This gives you the flexibility to either purge all goals from a specific template or selectively purge individual goals.

In the previous version, there was only one option for purging goals: purging by goal plan template. This meant you had to delete all goals associated with a template, even if you only wanted to remove specific ones.

2. Upload, Update, and Download XML Templates in Manage Templates

A long-awaited feature! Admins can now manage XML templates directly within the Manage Templates tool. This includes performance forms, 360 forms, goal plans, and development goal plan templates.

Key capabilities:

  • Upload new templates
  • Update existing templates
  • Download templates for offline editing
  • View template revisions to track change history

Permission required: Admin Center ‚Üí Administrator Permissions ‚Üí Manage Templates ‚Üí Upload and Update XML Templates

What's Changed:
In the current version, you can upload, update, and download XML templates directly in the Manage Templates interface. This streamlines template management and gives you full control over your configurations.

In the previous version, you couldn't upload, update, or download XML templates in Manage Templates. You had to rely on Provisioning.

3. Import Goals for Target Population 

Security and data governance just got better. Users can now import goals only for their assigned target population, preventing unauthorized goal imports for users outside their scope.

Configuration requirement: You need the "Import Goals for Target Population" permission in addition to the standard Import Goals permission.

4. Minor Enhancements to the Latest Goal Management

Multiple User Experience Enhancements

SAP has made numerous improvements to the latest Goal Management experience, including:

  • Enhanced confirmation messages with clearer wording
  • Improved error messages for reserved field IDs
  • Warning messages are displayed as prominent message strips
  • Ability to select up to 100 loaded goals at once (up from 20)
  • Simplified permission model for sharing team goals
  • Enhanced printing patterns for goal comments and linked learning sections

5. Deprecation Alert: Legacy Goal Management (Deletion: December 31, 2026)

Mark your calendars! Legacy Goal Management reached End of Maintenance on May 17, 2024, and will be completely deleted on December 31, 2026. It's time to migrate to the latest Goal Management experience.

Important note: Customers using legacy Development Goals who haven't migrated from Job Description Manager to Job Profile Builder or Talent Intelligence Hub should prioritize their migration by 2H 2026.

Performance Management

1. Transfer Individual Talent Data from Inactive to Active Employment

Great news for rehires and employees returning from global assignments! The new Manage Individual Talent Data Transfer tool allows seamless transfer of talent data from inactive to active employment records.

Prerequisites:

  • Employee Central enabled for multiple employments
  • Enable the feature in Admin Center ‚Üí Company System and Logo Settings
  • Configure employment differentiators for accurate transfers

 

2. Enhanced Business Rules and Scenarios

SAP has introduced powerful new rule scenarios:

  • Change Field Visibility, Editability, and Required Status on Forms: Dynamically control field behavior based on conditions. Administrators can set specific fields on a form to visible or hidden, editable or read-only, and required or optional when certain conditions are met.
  • Add Review Steps Upon Form Routing: Automatically insert additional review steps when specific conditions are met. Admins can add one or multiple steps to the Modify stage of a form when it's being routed to the next step.
  • Get Count of Ratings: A new function to count goal, skill, or competency ratings matching specific criteria on a form.

3. Enhancements to Data Viewing in Full Profile

SAP has introduced more enhancements to the data viewing experience with Full Profile cards:

Trend Information Card Changes: In the previous version, the maximum value on the rating scale was shown together with the actual rating (e.g., 3-Meets Expectations/5-Outstanding). Now, the actual rating, maximum value, and minimum value are shown separately in three distinct columns for better clarity.

Calibration History Card Enhancement: The Calibration History card is now person-based rather than employment-based. It shows an employee's calibration sessions from all employments. Users with proper permissions can view all session records of an employee with multiple employments. When a user changes to a different employment, they can still access the same Calibration History card for that employee.

Configuration: Full Profile's redesigned data viewing experience is enabled by default through Admin Center ‚Üí Company System and Logo Settings ‚Üí Enable Full Profile for the latest People Profile.

4. Latest People Profile Card View on Performance Management Forms

When Full Profile is enabled, you can now configure card links in form templates using the format [[CARDLINK|<cardId>|<displayName>]]. Users will see button-style links that open the latest People Profile cards directly within forms.

Backward compatibility: Existing block links from legacy templates can also redirect to the updated card view when certain conditions are met.

In the current version, you can add card links to the form, which will display the latest card view. Block links that meet specific conditions will also display the card view

5. Comprehensive Form Experience Enhancements

The latest Performance Management form experience now includes:

  • EZ Rater support: View official ratings and employee ratings side by side with rating gaps. In the legacy experience, EZ Rater displayed ratings side by side. In the latest experience, the side-by-side view and rating gaps are automatically available through the Gap Analysis feature. EZ Rater can be enabled for users without Gap Analysis access.
  • Enhanced printing capabilities:
    • All form content including goal comments and learning activities can now be printed
    • Custom layout printing is now supported - users can choose between Custom Layout and Standard Layout
    • Form snapshots (accessed through reports or audit trails) now have a dedicated Print button
  • Improved side panel: Now displays unofficial ratings, expected ratings, and rating gaps alongside the main page
  • Goal status field color: When text colors for goal status are configured in the goal plan template, those colors now apply to the goal status on the form
  • Competency rating help text: Added clarifying help text for read-only rating fields in competencies with behaviors, explaining that ratings are calculated based on behavior ratings
  • Optimized Team Ranker popover: Maximum height is now limited to 50% of the screen for better usability with long team member lists
  • Better experience for proxy users: When proxy users don't have full proxy rights, unavailable module content is hidden with a clear warning message explaining required permissions, rather than showing empty sections
  • Cleaner read-only interface: Action buttons (like Create Activity, Manage Learning) are now hidden when users access read-only forms or sections, eliminating confusion

5. Legacy Form Experience Deprecation (Deletion: November 20, 2026)

The legacy Performance Management form experience reached End of Development on November 14, 2025, and will be deleted on November 20, 2026. Plan your migration to the latest experience accordingly.

6. Mass Route Ungrouped Forms to a Specific Step (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators can now mass route multiple ungrouped forms to a specific step, provided they share the same template and route map. This feature significantly reduces administrative overhead when managing large numbers of forms.

7. AI-Assisted Performance Insights with Adjusted Time Frame (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

To improve relevancy and performance, AI-assisted insights now apply a one-year upper limit to data sources:

  • Review periods ‚â§ 1 year: All data from the period is used
  • Review periods > 1 year: All form comments plus one year of data from other sources

8. Granular Data Retention and Purge Capabilities (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators now have fine-grained control over data retention policies:

  • Configure retention periods by specific form templates
  • Define retention periods in days (in addition to months and years)
  • Preview which forms will be excluded from purge operations and understand why

When setting up DRTM Performance Reviews purge requests in Admin Center  Data Retention Management, administrators can specify templates in a purge request to purge forms that use them. In preview reports of DRTM Performance Reviews purge requests, besides forms to be purged, administrators can now see forms that are excluded and the reasons why they're excluded.

9. Enhanced AI-Assisted Writing (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

AI-assisted writing actions (Generate Comments and Improve My Feedback) are now available for goals, extending the capability beyond skills, competencies, and behaviors.

Calibration

1. Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions

Administrators can now schedule automatic activation of calibration sessions using the new "Auto-activate sessions" setting in calibration templates. The feature includes:

  • Template-level or session-level activation dates
  • New job type: "Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions on Planned Date"
  • Optional enforcement mode that removes subjects with validation errors to allow activation
  • Email notifications detailing activation results

2. Exclude Contingent Workers When Creating Calibration Sessions

A new global setting automatically removes contingent workers from calibration sessions during creation, streamlining session setup for core employees.

  • Users can create sessions using the Manage Calibration Sessions tool. When you search for users through the org chart or advanced search and then add the selected users to participant and subjects, a warning message will appear if any contingent workers are included, indicating which ones have been removed.
  • Managers create sessions directly on the landing page of Calibration.
  • You create multiple calibration sessions using a validated CSV file.

However, any contingent worker already added to a session will remain included when you activate those sessions.

3. Rating Change History Available in Calibration Sessions

Transparency gets a boost! Users can now track all rating changes within calibration sessions through a dedicated Rating Change History page, showing old ratings, new ratings, who made changes, and when.

4. Comments from Other Calibration Sessions Now Counted

The comment feature now shows total counts from both the current session and other sessions based on the same template. View comments separately in "From This Session" and "From Other Sessions" tabs.

Configuration: Enable "Roll up comments from other sessions based on the same template" in the calibration template settings.

5. Additional Calibration Enhancements

  • Remove inactive subjects from all calibration sessions
  • Display extra fields for subjects in both Bin and Matrix views
  • Bin width adjustments now save automatically

360 Reviews

1. Add Link to Detailed 360 Report in Email Notifications

Users can now access Detailed 360 Reports directly from email notifications using the new tag [[PM360_DETAILED_REPORT_URL]]. This eliminates the need to navigate through the system to find reports.

2. Multiple Email Reminders for Upcoming Steps (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Administrators can now schedule multiple reminder notifications ahead of 360 review step due dates. Use the new "Series Due Notification Dates" option to enter comma-separated values for multiple reminders (e.g., 2,3,5,7 for reminders 2, 3, 5, and 7 days before the due date).

3. Hide Radar Charts Option (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

A new switch in Form Template Settings allows you to hide radar charts on Detailed 360 Reports when attribute names are lengthy and affect readability.

4. Minor Enhancements Include:

  • Improved spacing in Competency and Objective sections
  • Retention of original category information for re-added participants
  • Links to generate development goals in Assisted 360 Reviews Insights
  • Enhanced error messages for troubleshooting
  • Behavior information now included in AI-generated comments

5. Deprecation Alert: Spell Check Feature (Deletion: May 14, 2026)

The Spell Check feature reached End of Maintenance on May 17, 2024, and will be deleted on May 14, 2026.

Key Dates:

  • End of Development: November 17, 2023
  • End of Maintenance: May 17, 2024
  • Deletion: May 14, 2026

Plan to adopt alternative spell-checking methods before the deletion date.

Continuous Performance Management

1. Enhanced Word Counting and Increased Length Limits (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Word counts now use characters instead of bytes, with extended length limits:

  • Channel invitation notes: 4000 characters
  • Activity names: 4000 characters
  • Activity comments: 4000 characters
  • Achievement names: 4000 characters
  • Meeting notes: 2000 characters
  • Feedback answers: 4000 characters

2. Feedback Functionality Supported for More Activities (Valid as of: November 14, 2025)

Users can now request and view feedback on activities in any channels where they are participants, not just manager-direct report relationships. This enables feedback collection across temporary assignments and cross-functional projects.

3. Expanded AI-Assisted Writing

AI-assisted writing is now available in more text areas:

  • Continuous Performance: Activity names, updates, achievement names, meeting notes, discussion topics, channel invitation notes
  • Continuous Feedback: Feedback topics and questions

4. Enhancements to Microsoft Teams Integration

The Create Activity quick action in Microsoft Teams now includes:

  • New Link buttons to connect activities with multiple performance and development goals
  • Ability to search for goals or link to displayed goal plans
  • More flexibility than the previous dropdown approach

5. Share Activities Across Channels

Channel participants can now share activities across multiple channels for seamless collaboration. Features include:

  • Control over whether target channel owners can view and comment
  • Visual indicators for shared activities
  • Reportable sharing records via Story reports
  • Activity Sharing and Captured Activity Sharing data tables

Please feel free to share your ideas and questions in the comment box of this blog. I‚Äôd be glad to share what I know with you. Also, do share your thoughts on the latest changes, and the features you valued the most. Share this blog with your colleagues.

Thank you!!

entry.title: Need help installing Crystal Reports 2016 for user please
entry.content:
**Originally emailed to SAP, but was directed to use the community**

Hello, I am supporting a user who needs Crystal Reports installing on their laptop. They had previously had a version installed and it was registered with a license key, but we weren't able to find any details about the license or the registration. I managed to recover the license key from a different laptop which also had the software installed and registered. When I have tried to install Crystal Reports on the user's laptop, I am getting an error saying the license key is invalid or expired but I am not certain I am installing the correct version. 

I am hoping you will be able to tell me the correct version of Crystal Reports to install and if the licence has expired, please. I attempted to install ProductID=11.5.10.1263.2.01.Full (Crystal Reports XI) as this is the version we have saved in our installs location. 

The version installed on the laptop I retrieved the licence key from is 11.0.0.128227 but it looks like that version is not available for download? 

The version installed on the old laptop is SAP Crystal reports 2016 support pack 2, version 14.2.2.1975, this doesn't match what is in regedit

The license key I retrieved from regedit is D720F-*******-*******-3A40040

I've downloaded the 2016 SP8 free trial and tried installing, but am getting a 'Failed to update setup engine executables. Program will exit' error. Any help would be much appreciated- or, if I need to let them know that they need to buy a license for a more up-to-date version.

Thank you!

entry.title: How to Load Non-Refunded Container Deposit Amount to Material Cost (Inventory G/L)
entry.content:
Hi Community Members,

I have a scenario in import material procurement where a container deposit amount is paid in advance to the shipping line. In most cases, this amount is fully refunded after the shipment and arrival of goods.

However, in some cases, the full amount is not refunded ‚Äî a partial deduction is made by the shipping line due to certain reasons. This deduction is usually realized after two or three months when we receive the final refund confirmation.

Now, I want to load this non-refunded (deducted) amount to the material or inventory cost in SAP.

Below is current Accounting entries treatment the business is doing in their legacy ERP

Advance Recording

Container Deposit‚ÄÉDr‚ÄÉ1000
Clearing Account (Vendor)‚ÄÉCr‚ÄÉ1000

Advance Payment

Clearing Account (Vendor)‚ÄÉDr‚ÄÉ1000
Bank Account‚ÄÉCr‚ÄÉ1000

If Full Refund:
Bank Account‚ÄÉDr‚ÄÉ1000
Container Deposit‚ÄÉCr‚ÄÉ1000

If Partial Refund:
Bank Account‚ÄÉDr‚ÄÉ800
Container Deposit‚ÄÉCr‚ÄÉ800

Adjustment and Settlement of non refund amount:
Raw Material Stock GL‚ÄÉDr‚ÄÉ200
Container Deposit‚ÄÉCr‚ÄÉ200

Can anyone please guide me on the best possible process or configuration to handle this scenario in SAP S/4HANA?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Is Your Traceability Strategy Ready for 2027? Discover SAP Corporate Serialization
entry.content:
Product traceability is no longer just a regulatory requirement; it has become a strategic imperative. Today, it underpins risk management, accelerates recalls, and builds consumer trust in increasingly complex supply chains. A robust traceability strategy safeguards brand integrity and drives competitive advantage in a market that demands transparency.

Historically, industries relied on SAP Auto-ID Infrastructure (AII) and SAP Object Event Repository (OER) on the NetWeaver platform as the standard for traceability, turning compliance into operational efficiency. But with SAP ending mainstream maintenance for NetWeaver applications by 2027, forward-thinking companies must plan their next move.

The strategic path forward is migration to SAP Corporate Serialization. More than an upgrade, it‚Äôs a transformative step that unifies AII and OER capabilities into a modern, integrated platform designed for today‚Äôs global supply chains. This transition future-proofs operations, meets evolving transparency requirements, and positions businesses for sustainable growth.

This article will guide supply chain leaders through this critical shift, addressing the most pressing questions about SAP Corporate Serialization:

  • What is SAP Corporate Serialization?
  • What capabilities does SAP Corporate Serialization offer?
  • What are the use cases of SAP Corporate Serialization?
  • What is the business value of SAP Corporate Serialization?

 

What is SAP Corporate Serialization?

SAP Corporate Serialization is a secure, private cloud-based SaaS solution that layers seamlessly on top of existing SAP ERP systems, consolidating the capabilities of SAP AII and SAP OER into a single, cohesive platform. It provides scalable serialization management, integrating with shop-floor systems and meeting global regulatory requirements.

The solution enables end-to-end visibility across the entire product lifecycle; from subcomponents to finished goods; transforming traceability from static records into a dynamic narrative. It authenticates products, combats counterfeiting, and manages both batch and logistics unit distribution. By unifying serialized data and events across suppliers, manufacturing sites, and customers, and integrating with systems like ERP, WMS, MES, and RFID/barcode technologies, SAP Corporate Serialization captures every event from production to delivery (Figure 1)

Figure 1:- System Landscape with SAP Corporate Serialization

 

What capabilities does SAP Corporate Serialization offer?

1. Central Serial Number Management: Generate flexible alphanumeric, randomized, or product-specific serials and distribute them in bulk, reducing manual effort, ensuring accuracy, and supporting compliance.

2. End-to-End Integration and Extensibility: Connect seamlessly with SAP Business Network, SAP EWM, SAP ECC/S/4HANA, and non-SAP systems (Figure 2), while also extending the solution to accommodate customer-specific requirements and traceability attributes; enhancing operational decision-making and supply chain visibility.

Figure 2: SAP Corporate Serialization Integration Options

3. Automation and Standardization: Automate serialization, reporting, and data exchange; streamlining workflows, enforcing consistent processes, and lowering risk of errors.

4. User Experience and Interfaces Monitoring: Intuitive SAP GUI and FIORI interfaces combined with SAP Application Interface Framework (AIF) monitoring; enabling faster onboarding, real-time transaction oversight, and quick resolution of exceptions.

5. Future-Proof, Cost-Efficient Architecture: Supports GS1, EPCIS, and other formats like IMEI, UID, and UDI. Consolidates legacy AII and OER systems, minimizes customization, and aligns with SAP S/4HANA and industry standards; reducing total cost of ownership while preparing businesses for evolving regulatory and operational demands.

 

What are the use cases of SAP Corporate Serialization?

SAP Corporate Serialization delivers flexible, industry-specific solutions that transform traceability from a compliance requirement into a strategic advantage. In automotive, it tracks EV batteries and safety-critical components throughout production and service lifecycles. Aerospace and defense benefit from full traceability of iUID-marked parts to meet stringent regulatory standards.

Consumer products leverage the platform to authenticate goods, combat counterfeiting, and engage buyers through digital product passports, while managing reusable assets like beverage kegs. In consumer electronics, it ensures serialization of devices, components, and software licenses, supporting traceability, warranty tracking, and fraud prevention. Tobacco and beverage industries use SAP Corporate Serialization to manage serial numbers linked to tax stamps and track premium or returnable products; ensuring compliance, authenticity, and streamlined reuse.

The hi-tech, utilities, and specialty gas sectors gain precise tracking of high-value components, spare parts, and cylinders, improving asset visibility, safety, and operational efficiency. In agribusiness, each pallet or shipment is tagged with a unique serial number, capturing its journey from harvest to delivery; enhancing logistics, inventory accuracy, and supply chain transparency.

Healthcare and medical device companies benefit from UDI compliance and post-sale serialization, linking components to digital service records to optimize lifecycle management, anticipate maintenance, and strengthen customer trust.

Across all these sectors, SAP Corporate Serialization proves its scalability and adaptability, supporting both compliance-driven and value-driven business outcomes, while turning traceability into a driver of efficiency, trust, and growth.

 

What is the business value of SAP Corporate Serialization?

Transitioning to SAP Corporate Serialization is not just about staying supported beyond 2027; it‚Äôs a strategic move that transforms traceability into a driver of efficiency, visibility, and growth. The platform operates in the background like an autopilot, automating serial number management operations, which improving employee productivity and freeing QA, logistics, and customer service teams to focus on exceptions, while providing instant access to service histories.

By centralizing serialized data, it reduces compliance and risk management costs, streamlines QA and RA workflows, and provides fully traceable records for audits. During recalls, affected products or components are identified quickly and precisely, minimizing operational disruption and waste.

Beyond operational gains, SAP Corporate Serialization safeguards brand reputation and drives sales. End-to-end traceability ensures authenticity, combats counterfeiting, and builds consumer trust, while digital experiences like product passports enhance engagement and encourage repeat purchases; protecting both brand and revenue.

Conclusion

The adoption of SAP Corporate Serialization is far more than a system upgrade; it‚Äôs a strategic investment in resilience, transparency, and long-term competitiveness. As the 2027 deadline approaches, the companies that act now will not only secure compliance but also unlock new value through lower costs, greater agility, and stronger consumer trust.

The question is no longer if serialization will redefine your supply chain, but how fast you can position your business to lead. Our team stands ready to partner with you; bringing best practices and proven expertise to ensure a seamless transition and help you capture the full potential of an intelligent product traceability ecosystem.

Learn how leading companies leverage SAP Corporate Serialization to achieve end-to-end product traceability, reduce operational complexity, and drive business resilience.

 

Feature by

Aladdin Mandishah and Falk Deckert, SAP

Upender Solanki, Novatio Solutions

entry.title: Re: Advanced Intercompany Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Kaz_Iwamoto,                                                                                                                                                                                                        We are using the AIC sales process.
For the following scenario the CBIC order get´s zero quantity after reassign confirmed qty. to another SO by using CO06, please see executed steps in ERQ:

SO 100189959 created, all three items got confirmed quantity
IC PO 7100000510 and CBIC SO 60004722 got automatically created
new SO 100189960 created with same material/quantity as SO 100189959/item 30
via CO06 the 1000 PCE for material 1132396 have been reassigned from SO 100189959/item 30 to SO 100189960/item 10 the IC PO 7100000510/item 30 got automatically blocked and the quantity for CBIC SO 60004722/item 30 has changed automatically to zero and item got incompleted due to zero order quantity and zero net value (incompletion log SAP standard)

The issue is now that this incompleted CBIC SO 60004722 prevents the automatic creation of the IC billing document. 

Sometimes our sales responsibles need to shift quantities between customer orders if only limited stock is available, quite common in backorder processing. Am I not allowed to reassign or reschedule confirmed quantities using CO06 in the AIC process? Is there a reason for that?

Thank you for your support.

Best regards

Onur

entry.title: Re: Balancing field profit center not filled in gl line i...
entry.content:
To derive the account assignments into the supplier line item in Post on Account from the journal entries involved in the clearing you need to use a different document type. You can use document type  KP or ZV 


See help.sap.con Clearing Transactions (Business Transaction 1010) https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/91fdbc50ab9a4d7480a771da7b7bb34d.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST


See also kba 2841450 Customer and Vendor - Open items clear together

entry.title: Re: Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Gerhard_Welker ,                                                                                                                                                                                                        We are using the AIC sales process.
For the following scenario the CBIC order get´s zero quantity after reassign confirmed qty. to another SO by using CO06, please see executed steps in ERQ:

SO 100189959 created, all three items got confirmed quantity
IC PO 7100000510 and CBIC SO 60004722 got automatically created
new SO 100189960 created with same material/quantity as SO 100189959/item 30
via CO06 the 1000 PCE for material 1132396 have been reassigned from SO 100189959/item 30 to SO 100189960/item 10 the IC PO 7100000510/item 30 got automatically blocked and the quantity for CBIC SO 60004722/item 30 has changed automatically to zero and item got incompleted due to zero order quantity and zero net value (incompletion log SAP standard)

The issue is now that this incompleted CBIC SO 60004722 prevents the automatic creation of the IC billing document. 

Sometimes our sales responsibles need to shift quantities between customer orders if only limited stock is available, quite common in backorder processing. Am I not allowed to reassign or reschedule confirmed quantities using CO06 in the AIC process? Is there a reason for that?

Thank you for your support.

Best regards

Onur

In Public Cloud WM the API_FORM_PRINT_SRV is not available as of now.

We suggest you to use APP Manage Output Items (APP ID F2279) and Maintain Print queues, this will partially fulfill your requirement.

In relation to the availability of API API_FORM_PRINT_SRV I suggest you create a feature request to SAP (2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Product). With an Influence request opened, the feature request gains visibility by other customers and might speed up the release of this functionality in further product versions.

entry.title: How to enable API_FORM_PRINT_SRV in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We would like to request activation of the standard API API_FORM_PRINT_SRV in our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant.

Business Context

After performing Goods Receipt, the user needs to generate and print HU labels for internal storage and identification purposes.

We have already designed a form template named YY1_EWM_HU_LABEL, based on the standard data source FDP_HU_SHIPPINGLABEL_SRV (Handling Unit Label).

This form needs to be rendered and printed directly from our custom Fiori app.

Requested Action

How to access to the API_FORM_PRINT_SRV service (part of SAP Forms Service by Adobe Integration API), or advise an equivalent successor API that allows:

Server-side rendering of the HU Label (Adobe Form).

Automatic release of the generated output to a print queue (e.g., HU_LABEL_Q) managed via Cloud Print Manager.

Optional retrieval of rendered PDF for preview via Fiori UI.

Business Process: Goods Receipt and Handling Unit Label Printing

Form Template: YY1_EWM_HU_LABEL (Data Source: FDP_HU_SHIPPINGLABEL_SRV)

Expected Behavior: Server-side PDF rendering and print queue integration for HU Label forms from a custom Fiori UI5 application

The API API_FORM_PRINT_SRV is not currently visible or available in our tenant under Communication Arrangements or SAP API Business Hub.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Efficiently Purging Large Number of Deleted Media Blobs
entry.content:
Context

SAP Commerce Cloud in the Public Cloud relies on asynchronous Media Deletions to remove unused media files from backing Cloud Storage.

However, many customers overlook the importance of regularly scheduling the built-in purgeDeletedFilesCronJob. When left inactive, this can lead to serious issues::

  • The mediadeletions table grows unchecked, potentially reaching massive sizes
  • Blob files for unused media remain physically undeleted
  • The 5 TB storage limit defined by SAP‚Äôs Fair Use Policy may be exceeded

The purgeDeletedFilesCronJob is meant to be scheduled and executed regularly and is not designed to process large number of the mediadeletions tables. When the table has become too large, the activate the CronJob can be running for very long time (several weeks).

While SAP Support offers a workaround via KBA 3487492‚Äîa Groovy script intended to speed up purging‚Äîthe solution falls short of true multithreading due to its synchronous execution design.

 

The script in 3487492 is not multithread for real due to the above code issue, effectively running one thread after the other in a synchronous way (ref. Future.get())

This blog post presents a practical fix: a custom, abortable, multi-threaded scripting CronJob that allows controlled purging of the mediadeletions table. It‚Äôs designed to be flexible, efficient, and safe for production environments‚Äîonce properly tested.

DISCLAIMER: The code provided in this blog post is shared for informational and educational purposes only. The author cannot be held responsible for any issues, damages, or disruptions resulting from its use or execution. It is strongly recommended that you review, test, and validate the code thoroughly in a non-production (test) environment before deploying it to production.
Please note that the author offers no warranty or maintenance support for this code.

Setup

The following ImpEx will create the purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob: 

INSERT_UPDATE Script; code[unique=true];active[unique=true];content
;purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedScript;true;"
import de.hybris.platform.core.Registry
import de.hybris.platform.core.TenantAwareThreadFactory
import de.hybris.platform.cronjob.enums.CronJobResult
import de.hybris.platform.cronjob.enums.CronJobStatus
import de.hybris.platform.media.exceptions.MediaRemovalException
import de.hybris.platform.servicelayer.cronjob.PerformResult
import org.apache.commons.lang3.BooleanUtils
import org.apache.log4j.Logger

import java.util.concurrent.*
import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong

def iterationCount = 2000
def chunkSize = 10000
def minAgeInHours = 48
def batchSize = 50
def deletionWorkerThreads = 24
// Ensure queue size is at least (chunkSize / batchSize)
def deletionWorkerQueueSize = 1000

def logger = Logger.getLogger(""purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob"")

logger.info(""Batch Size: ${batchSize}, Chunk Size: ${chunkSize}, Deletion Worker Threads: ${deletionWorkerThreads}, Iteration count: ${iterationCount}, Minimum age: ${minAgeInHours}"")

def executor = new ThreadPoolExecutor(deletionWorkerThreads, deletionWorkerThreads,
		0L, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS,
		new LinkedBlockingQueue<>(deletionWorkerQueueSize),
		new TenantAwareThreadFactory(Registry.currentTenant))
def deletedCount = new AtomicLong()
def iteration = 0

long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
try {
	while (!BooleanUtils.isTrue(cronjob.requestAbort) && iteration++ < iterationCount) {
		long iterationStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
		logger.info(""Iteration (${iteration}/${iterationCount}): fetching deletions from the database..."")
		def deletions = mediaDeletionService.findDeletions(chunkSize, minAgeInHours)
		if (deletions.isEmpty()) {
			logger.info(""No more data available. Exiting."")
			break
		}
		logger.info(""Iteration (${iteration}/${iterationCount}): deletions fetched from the database: ${deletions.size()}"")

		def batches = deletions.collate(batchSize)
		def futures = new LinkedList<Future<Long>>()
		batches.eachWithIndex { batch, index ->
			// Submit task and wait for its completion
			futures.add(executor.submit({
				logger.info(""Processing batch ${index + 1} of ${batches.size()}, batch size: ${batch.size()}"")
				long batchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
				def deletedCountInBatch = 0l
				batch.each { deletion ->
					if (deletion != null) {
						def config = mediaStorageConfigService.getConfigForFolder(deletion.getFolderQualifier())
						try {
							logger.debug(""Deleting media from location: ${deletion.getOriginalLocation()}, ${deletion.getFolderQualifier()}..."")
							cloudAzureBlobStorageStrategy.deleteBackup(config, deletion.getOriginalLocation())
							//Delete media file from Azure blob storage
							logger.debug(""Deleted media from location: ${deletion.getOriginalLocation()}, ${deletion.getFolderQualifier()}"")

							logger.debug(""Deleting MediaDeletion data from DB for: ${deletion.getOriginalLocation()}, ${deletion.getFolderQualifier()}..."")
							//Remove MediaDeletion data from DB
							mediaDeletionService.discardDeletion(deletion)
							logger.debug(""Deleted MediaDeletion data from DB for: ${deletion.getOriginalLocation()}, ${deletion.getFolderQualifier()}"")
							deletedCountInBatch++
						} catch (MediaRemovalException e) {
							logger.error(""Could not remove media from location: ${deletion.getOriginalLocation()}, ${deletion.getFolderQualifier()}"", e)
						}
					}
				}
				long batchExecutionTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - batchStartTime
				logger.info(""Batch ${index + 1} execution time: ${batchExecutionTime} ms, deleted items: ${deletedCountInBatch}. Deleted items totally by now: ${deletedCount.addAndGet(deletedCountInBatch)}"")

				return deletedCountInBatch
			} as Callable<Long>))
		}
		def deletedCountInChunk = futures.collect { it.get() }.sum()
		long iterationEndTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
		long iterationExecutionTime = iterationEndTime - iterationStartTime
		logger.info(""Iteration (${iteration}/${iterationCount}): deleted items: ${deletedCountInChunk} in ${iterationExecutionTime} ms"")

		// refresh for getting refreshed abort flag
		modelService.refresh(cronjob)
	}

	if (BooleanUtils.isTrue(cronjob.requestAbort)) {
		logger.info(""Abort requested, terminating cronjob..."")
		cronjob.requestAbort = null
		modelService.save(cronjob) //store flag
		return new PerformResult(CronJobResult.UNKNOWN, CronJobStatus.ABORTED)
	} else {
	return new PerformResult(CronJobResult.SUCCESS, CronJobStatus.FINISHED)
	}
} catch (Throwable t) {
	logger.error(""Unexpected error"", t)
	return new PerformResult(CronJobResult.ERROR, CronJobStatus.FINISHED)
}
finally {
	executor.shutdown()
	executor.awaitTermination(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
	totalExecutionTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime
	logger.info(""Total deletions processed: ${deletedCount.get()} in ${totalExecutionTime} ms"")
}
"

INSERT_UPDATE ScriptingJob; code[unique=true];scriptURI
;purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedJob;model://purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedScript

INSERT_UPDATE CronJob; code[unique=true];job(code);sessionLanguage(isocode)
;purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob;purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedJob;en

INSERT_UPDATE Trigger ; cronJob(code)[unique=true] 			   ; second ; minute ; hour ; day ; month ; year ; relative ; active ; maxAcceptableDelay
                      ; purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob  ; 0      ; 0      ; 20    ; -1  ; -1   ; -1   ; false    ; true  ; -1

 

Review and adjust the Trigger defined for purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob  depending on your needs and constraints.

The following parameters can be used to control how the CronJob is executed :

ParameterDescription
iterationCount Number of iteration to queries mediadeletions  
chunkSize Maximum number of mediasdeletions which must be returned in one iteration
minAgeInHoursMinimum mediadeletion age which must be returned in one iteration
batchSize Size of batches executed by a deletion worker thread
deletionWorkerThreads Number of deletion worker threads
deletionWorkerQueueSize Deletion worker threads queue size. Ensure queue size is at least (chunkSize / batchSize )

Executing, Monitoring & Cancelling CronJob

To run the CronJob :

  1. Go to Backoffice ‚Üí CronJobs
  2. Search for purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob
  3. Click the Run CronJob button

To monitor the CronJob :

  1. Ensure the purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob logger is configured to INFO level
  2. Go to OpenSearch ‚Üí Discover
  3. Configure the following filter : 
    {
  "query": {
    "match_phrase": {
      "logs.loggerName": "purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob"
    }
  }
}

To cancel the CronJob :

  1. Go to Backoffice ‚Üí CroJobs
  2. Search for purgeDeletedFilesMultiThreadedCronJob
  3. Select the Administration tab
  4. Select True for Request Abort attribute
  5. Save the CronJob

Conclusion

Properly managing media deletions in SAP Commerce Cloud is not just a matter of housekeeping‚Äîit‚Äôs essential for staying within storage limits and maintaining system performance. By implementing a multi-threaded, abortable CronJob setup, you can overcome the limitations of SAP‚Äôs default script and ensure a scalable, controllable purge process. Always test thoroughly in a non-production environment before deploying, and remember: proactive scheduling is key to avoiding costly delays and compliance risks.

If you want to further streamline your Media and Cloud Storage, I recommend you this great post How to Reduce Cloud Storage usage on SAP Commerce Cloud from @YannickRobin

entry.title: How to Identify Selections Used in RKFs in Rows/Columns of BW/BEx Queries
entry.content:
In continuation of my previous blog (Section 5 of All about Bex Query elements in SAP BW/BW4HANA - SAP Community), this post focuses on example involving Restricted Key Figures (RKFs) in SAP BW/BEx queries.

In this blog, I explain the best way to extract or identify the selection criteria applied in RKFs that are used in the rows or columns of a BW/BEx query.

When a query contains only a few rows or columns (e.g., 5‚Äì10), it's relatively easy to manually check the selections used in each RKF. However, in more complex reports such as Balance Sheet or Income Statement reports with over 50 rows manually checking each row or column becomes time consuming and inefficient.

To overcome this challenge, we can leverage backend SAP BW tables to extract the relevant details and analyze them in Excel. The key tables involved in this process are:

  • RSRREPDIR ‚Äì Query directory
  • RSZELTXREF ‚Äì Element cross-reference
  • RSZRANGE ‚Äì Selection ranges
  • RSZELTDIR ‚Äì Element directory

By correlating these tables, we can efficiently retrieve the selection criteria used in RKFs that are used in the rows or columns of a BW/BEx query, saving significant manual effort.

Steps to Identify Selections Used in RKFs in Rows and Columns of a BW/BEx Query.

Step 1: In the Table RSZCOMPDIR / RSRREPDIR enter the query technical name in the field COMPID to obtain the COMPUID of the query.Screenshot 1 : Output of RSRREPDIR table

Step 2: In the RSZELTXREF table, enter the COMPUID of the query (from step 1) in the field SELTUID to obtain TELTUID.Screenshot 2 : Output of RSZELTXREF table

Step 3: Again, in the RSZELTXREF table, enter TELTUID (from step 2, where LAYTP = ‚ÄòSOB‚Äô) in the field SELTUID and execute the table.Screenshot 3: Output of RSZELTXREF table

Step 4: Again, in the RSZELTXREF table, enter TELTUID (from step 3, where LAYTP = ‚ÄòCOL/ROW‚Äô) in the field SELTUID and execute the table.Screenshot 4 : Output of RSZELTXREF table

Note : If there are direct selections (i.e., no RKFs) used in the rows/columns of the query, you can skip Step 5 & 6 and proceed directly to Step 7.

Step 5: Again, in the RSZELTXREF table, enter TELTUID (from step 4) in the field SELTUID and execute the table.Screenshot 5 : Output of RSZELTXREF table

Repeat Step 5 until the RSZELTXREF table returns zero entries.

Step 6: Collect all TELTUID values from the previous steps into an Excel sheet and remove any duplicates.Screenshot 6 : List of all TELTUIDs from all steps

Step 7:  Go to the RSZRANGE table and enter the TELTUID values (from Excel) into the SELTUID field. Execute the table to retrieve the selection details used in the rows and columns.Screenshot 7 : Selection details

Step 8: Open the RSZELTDIR table and enter the same TELTUID values (from Excel) into the SELTUID field. Execute the table to get the technical names and descriptions of the elements.Screenshot 8: Technical names and descriptions of the elements

Step 9: Download the outputs from Step 7 and Step 8 into Excel. Use the VLOOKUP formula to match and enrich the selection data from Step 7 with the descriptions from Step 8 Screenshot 9 : Final output with all required details

Conclusion : In complex SAP BW/BEx queries, especially those used in financial reports with numerous rows and columns, manually identifying selection criteria in Restricted Key Figures (RKFs) is inefficient. By leveraging backend BW tables such as RSRREPDIR, RSZELTXREF, RSZRANGE, and RSZELTDIR, users/Developers can systematically trace and extract RKF selections. This approach enables efficient analysis in Excel, significantly reducing manual effort and improving transparency in query design.

Happy Learning üòä

entry.title: Step-by-Step Guide to Using Pallets in SAP CPI Integration Flows
entry.content:
What are Pallets in SAP CPI?

A Pallet in SAP CPI is a predefined collection of integration flow components that can be reused across different projects.

Think of it as a toolbox containing reusable steps, mappings, or configurations ‚Äî allowing you to drag and drop frequently used patterns instead of rebuilding them every time.

Here we have attached file which shows overview of all the pallets.

 

 Here are some pallets.

1- Process- A Process is the backbone of an Integration Flow. It contains all the steps and logic needed to move data from one system to another. Itis three types.

1- Integration Process- An Integration Process is a sequence of steps designed to handle data exchange between different systems using CPI. It is the main iflow. Itis the core structure that defines how data flows between systems. It‚Äôs like a workflow or blueprint that contains all the steps needed to move, transform, and route data.

2- Local Integration Process- A Local Integration Process is a reusable block of steps defined within the same iFlow. It allows you to separate logic into smaller, manageable sections without creating a separate artifact.‚Äã It is a special type of subprocess used within an iFlow to organize and modularize logic.

3-Exception SubProcess- Whenever we got an error in cpi, we go for exception subprocess. It tells us which iflows got failed through mail adapter and takes immediate action. ‚Äã
For example :‚Äã
If a message fails to reach the target system due to a network issue, the Exception Subprocess can log the error and send a notification to the support team.

 

Key Features:‚Äã

 

  • Automatically triggered when an error occurs‚Äã
  • Can include steps like logging, sending alerts, or retrying‚Äã
  • Helps improve reliability and maintainability of iFlow.

2- Transformation: Transformation refers to the process of changing the structure, format, or content of a message so that it can be understood by the target system. It consist content modifier, converter, encoder, decoder, filter.

‚Äã
1-Content Modifier- It is used to modify the content/data whatever we send to it . It consist three elements.

‚Äã
Message header- Here the data will be available during the run time and after the run time . It means the data will be access inside the cpi and also data can be sent to receiver.

‚Äã
Exchange Properties- Here the data will be available only during the run time. It means the data can be access only inside the cpi, here we can't send the data to reciever.

‚Äã
Message Body- whenever we need to send the data from one content to another then we go for message body .‚Äã  When we select constant then we write any text  in the body , when we select expression then we need to use camel expression ($(in.body)).

‚Äã

‚Äã

 

2- Converter- It is used to convert the data from one form to another.

XML to JSON- Here root element will come , if you want to remove it then you can select option like 'Suppress JSON Root Element'. Here Json data can be in array form if we select option like 'Convert XML Elements to JSON Array.

JSON to XML- Here the xml data will come without root node , if you want root node then we can select option like 'Add XML Root Element.

XML to CSV- Here we need to give the path of source element and parent element.‚Äã
‚Äã

CSV to XML- Here we need to upload xml schema (xsd file(convert xml to xsd online)) under processing . Here we  need to give path of target and also header will come by default, if you don't want then you need to select option like 'Exclude First Line Header.

3-Encoder- It is used to convert readable  data to non readable form. It Converts data into a specific format (like Base64 or encrypted form) before sending it to another system . Ensures data is secure, compressed, or formatted correctly for transmission.‚Äã

It is four type- Base64, Gzip, zip , MIME(Multipurpose internet mail extension)‚Äã

4-Decoder- It Converts encoded data back to its original format after receiving and also  helps the target system understand and process the message correctly.‚Äã

5-Filter- It is used to remove unwanted data . It support only XML data. It is five type.‚Äã

 Nodelist- It will give whole records which presents in data .‚Äã

 Node- It will give only single record. If we want to extract only specified record then we need to specified it. ‚Äã

Constant, Boolean, String.

‚Äã

3- Mapping- Mapping is the process of converting data from one format or structure to another so that the receiving system can understand and use it correctly.‚Äã

‚ÄãMessage mapping or Graphical mapping- A graphical tool to map fields from source to target. It Supports functions like concatenation, value mapping, and conditional logic. It support only XSD , EDMX and WSDL file. For Testing purpose it support only XML file.

XSLT Mapping- Basically it is used for removing the namespace in xsd file.‚Äã

Value Mapping- It Maps specific values from one system to another (for example country codes) and Can be maintained centrally and reused.‚Äã

Script-Based Mapping- It Uses Groovy or JavaScript for custom transformation logic and Useful when graphical mapping is not flexible enough.

‚Äã

4- ‚ÄãCall- A Call refers to invoking another process or service from within an integration flow. It helps in modularizing logic and reusing components.

1- External call- Here we can call it from anywhere like another iflows etc. It is of four type content enricher, poll enricher, request reply, send‚Äã.

Content Enricher- whenever we need to fetch data from two different system we can use it. The Content Enricher is a step in SAP CPI used to add extra data to a message by calling an external system or service during message processing.‚Äã

For example-If a message contains only a customer ID, the Content Enricher can call a customer database to fetch full customer details and add them to the original message.

Poll Enrich- The Poll Enricher is a special integration pattern in SAP CPI used to enrich a message by polling data from an external system at runtime.‚Äã
It is used for fetching the data in between timer and end of cpi. It support only SFTP adapter.

Request reply- The Request-Reply step in SAP CPI is used to send a request to an external system and wait for its response before continuing the integration flow. Request reply is nothing but requesting something and get back the response .

Sender- To deliver the message to an external system (e.g., SAP S/4 HANA, third-party API, database). It Uses adapters like HTTP, SOAP, SFTP, IDoc, etc.

 

 

 

2- Internal Call- It is only called inside the same iflows. It is three type indempotent process call , looping process call , process call‚Äã
‚Äã
Idempotent Process Call- An Idempotent Process Call in SAP CPI ensures that duplicate messages are not processed multiple times. It guarantees that even if the same message is sent more than once, the outcome remains the same ‚Äî only one instance is processed.‚Äã
For example- Imagine a payment system sends the same transaction twice due to a timeout. With Idempotent Process Call, CPI will process it only once, avoiding duplicate payments.‚Äã
‚Äã
Looping Process Call- The Looping Process Call in SAP CPI is used to repeat a subprocess multiple times, usually for each item in a list or based on a condition. Here some condition occure , if condition is true then it go to sub-iflows.

 

5- Message Routing- It consist of Aggregator, Gather , join, Multicast, Router, Splitter.

‚Äã
1- Aggregator- Collects and combines messages based on a condition (like count or timeout). Multi related record/data combines to form a single message/record. ‚Äã
for example- Collect 5 sales orders and send them as a batch to the ERP system every 10 minutes.‚Äã
‚Äã
2-Multicast- To send the same data to multiple branches at same time.

‚Äã
Parallel multicast- It is used when multiple reciever needs same data at same time.

‚Äã
Sequential multicast- Here every branches run one after another. If one branch get lost then hole system got failed.

Join- It doesn't have any data. It just keep alone branches in one frame . It is used after multicast.‚Äã
‚Äã
Gather- It is also used after multicast but instead of joining, it collects/ combine message from branches into one message. It is used for combining different data into one record.‚Äã
‚Äã
Splitter- It just Splits a single message into multiple smaller messages. It's two type general splitter , iterating splitter.

‚Äã
General splitter- Here the data will come with root node.

Iterating splitter ‚Äì Here the data will not come with root node.‚Äã
‚Äã
Router- It is used to send the message to different branches based on some condition. It works just like if-else condition.

 

6- ‚ÄãPersistence‚Äã- It consist of data store operation, persist and write variable.

1- Data store operation- whenever we need to store temporary data we go for data store operation. It has five elements.‚Äã
Write- It is used to write the data.‚Äã
Get- It is used to fetch the single specified record.‚Äã
Select- It is used to fetch more than one record.‚Äã
Delete- It is used to delete the record.‚Äã
‚Äã
2-Persist- Persistence in SAP CPI refers to the ability to store and retrieve data temporarily during message processing. It helps maintain state or pass values between steps in an iFlow.‚Äã
‚Äã
3-Write Variable- Here we can store the data globally.

7- Security- This palette is used to secure messages and data during integration. They help ensure confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of data exchanged between systems.

Encryptor

  • Encrypts message payload using algorithms like AES or RSA.
  • Used for securing sensitive data before transmission.

Decryptor

  • Decrypts encrypted payloads.
  • Ensures that only authorized systems can read the data.

 

Conclusion - ‚ÄãA clear understanding of all palettes in SAP Cloud Platform Integration enables developers to build efficient, scalable, and maintainable integration flows. By mastering each palette‚Äôs purpose and usage, one can design robust iFlows, troubleshoot effectively, and ensure seamless data exchange across systems, enhancing overall integration performance and reliability. 
‚Äã
‚Äã
‚Äã ‚Äã‚Äã

 

 

‚Äã

‚Äã

‚Äã

‚Äã

‚Äã

entry.title: Integrating SAP Document Information Extraction (Document AI) with SAP CAP ‚Äì Step by Step
entry.content:
Introduction :

In the SAP ecosystem, extracting meaningful data from documents such as invoices, contracts, or delivery notes‚Äîespecially in accounting, finance, and operational processes‚Äîis often a manual and time-consuming task.Since these documents are usually in PDF or scanned image formats, using traditional data processing methods to identify fields is both error-prone and unsustainable in the long run.This is where SAP Document AI comes into play.By leveraging AI-powered models, Document AI can automatically analyze documents and extract key fields such as invoice number, date, currency, supplier‚Äìcustomer information, and line items.This eliminates the need for manual data entry, making the overall process faster, more reliable, and significantly more efficient.In this blog post, I will walk you through the step-by-step process of enabling SAP Document AI on SAP BTP and integrating it with a CAP (Cloud Application Programming) project.Starting from service activation, we‚Äôll cover creating a service key, performing authentication (token retrieval), defining actions in CAP, uploading files, and storing the extracted Document AI results in a database.By the end of this guide, you‚Äôll have a fully functional CAP endpoint that can be tested via Postman.You‚Äôll learn how to send real PDF invoice files to Document AI and receive structured data in return‚Äîa foundation you can later extend with UI5 interfaces or workflow integrations.


Step 1 ‚Äî Creating the Document AI Service in SAP BTP

First, we need to enable the Document AI service in SAP BTP. To do this:

  1. Log in to your SAP BTP subaccount.
  2. Open the Service Marketplace .
  3. Find the SAP Document AI Trial service under the Artificial Intelligence category .

On the service details page, you'll see the Overview and Service Plans tabs. Click Create to create a service instance .

Select the default plan . This plan enables basic API access in a trial environment and creates the instance your CAP project needs to connect to the Document AI service.

Fill out the form below:

  1. Service: SAP Document AI Trial Version
    ‚Üí We will be using this service. Since it is a trial version, we will use the free trial quota.

  2. Plan: default
    ‚Üí Only the default plan is available in the trial environment. It is sufficient for basic use.

  3. Runtime Environment: Cloud Foundry
    ‚Üí Defines where the service will run. Cloud Foundry is often chosen for integration with CAP projects.

  4. Domain: dev
    ‚Üí Select the Cloud Foundry domain where your project is located (for example, dev, test).

Instance Name: DocAI
‚Üí You can give the service instance any name you want. This makes it easier to connect later (you can use lowercase, for example docai).

After filling in all the fields, you can click the Next button to proceed to the confirmation screens and complete the sample creation process.

Once the instance has been successfully created, the next step is to generate a Service Key for it . This key contains the authentication information needed for your CAP project to connect to the Document AI service.

  • Click the ellipsis ( ‚Ä¶ ) on the far right of your sample row .

  • Select Create Service Key from the menu .

In the dialog box:

 

  •  

    • In the Name field, enter a meaningful name such as DocAIKey .

    • You can leave the other settings at their default values.

    • Then click Create .

  • Once the Service Key is generated, click on its row to open the detail page.

After copying the JSON:

Adding Service Key details to the file To access .envthe Document AI service, we need to define credentials in our CAP project. To do this,
you can add a structure like the following to the file located in your project's root directory:.env

Correct the highlighted errors and try again.

Unsupported HTML code has been removed from your message. The HTML has been updated. Please review the message and send it when you are satisfied.

{
  "DOCAI_CLIENT_ID": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
  "DOCAI_CLIENT_SECRET": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
  "DOCAI_TOKEN_URL": "https://39c50baetrial.authentication.us10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token",
  "DOCAI_URL": "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1"
}

In real projects , instead of manually adding these details to the file .env, service keys are automatically linked to the application. This way, the application reads credentials from environment variables ( ) and is managed more securely. Automatic linking can also be achieved during deployment via MTA or manifest files VCAP_SERVICES.

service.cdsAction Definition in File

using { app as db } from '../db/schema';

service InvoiceService {
  entity Invoices as projection on db.Invoices;
  entity InvoiceItems as projection on db.InvoiceItems;

  action analyzeAndSave(file : LargeBinary, filename : String) returns {
     documentNumber : String(60);    
    documentDate   : Date;           
    currencyCode   : String(3);      
    senderName     : String(255);    
    receiverName   : String(255);   
    netAmount      : Decimal(15,2);  
    taxName        : String(40);     
    taxRate        : Decimal(5,2);   
    taxAmount      : Decimal(15,2);  
    grossAmount    : Decimal(15,2);  

  };
}

First, we define a CAP Action to send the PDF to the Document AI service and retrieve the result . This action can be triggered from the frontend or from tools like Postman.

For example, let's define an action with the following name :analyzeAndSave

  • filefield: Retrieves PDF file content in Base64 format.

  • filenamefield: Contains the file name.

  • returnssection: Returns key invoice fields from the AI ‚Äã‚Äãservice (for example, documentNumber, documentDate, currencyCode, etc.).

This step creates the backend point that will trigger access to the Document AI service.

At this point, we need to listen for the action we defined in the backend . To do this , we add an event handler to . When the action is triggered, this handler sends the file to the Document AI service, retrieves the analysis result, and saves it to the database. The entire flow is managed within this function.analyzeAndSaveservice.cdssrv/service.js

module.exports = cds.service.impl(function () {
  this.on("analyzeAndSave", async (req) => {
    // We define the **helper functions required for the Document AI integration**.

  });
});

 

Obtaining a Token (Authentication)
Now that we've defined the service credentials in the file.env, we need to obtain an access token to send requests to the Document AI service.We'll add the following sample functionto our file:
getTokensrv/service.js

const axios = require("axios");

async function getToken() {
  const r = await axios.post(
    process.env.DOCAI_TOKEN_URL,
    new URLSearchParams({
      grant_type: "client_credentials",
      client_id: process.env.DOCAI_CLIENT_ID,
      client_secret: process.env.DOCAI_CLIENT_SECRET,
    }),
    { headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" } }
  );
  return r.data.access_token;
}

This function access_tokenreturns a value from the SAP Document AI service using the information in the file. This token will be used in subsequent API calls within the Authorization header ..env

In real projects, this step is often automated through target+service binding . The CAP application reads the necessary information VCAP_SERVICESfrom environment variables to obtain the token .

In this step, we retrieve the schemas defined in Document AI and
select the appropriate one for invoices. This allows the model to determine which fields to extract (e.g., Invoice ID, Date, Currency, etc.).

const schemas = await fetchSchemas(base, token);
console.log("[DocAI] schemas count =", schemas.length);

const chosen = pickInvoiceSchema(schemas);
if (!chosen) return req.error(500, "No invoice-related schema available in DOX");
console.log("[DocAI] chosen =", chosen);

 

    • fetchSchemas: Retrieves the schema list from DOX using the access token.

    • pickInvoiceSchema: Selects the schema whose name is invoice or contains the invoice .documentType

    • If none are found, return 500 (an obvious error to the developer).

    Base64 ‚Üí Buffer conversion (prepare the file)
    The PDF file received from the client (UI5/Postman) may be in Base64 format. If it is a Data URL (for example,data:application/pdf;base64,...), remove the prefix and convert it to a true binary buffer.

let b64 = Buffer.isBuffer(file) ? null : String(file);
if (b64 && b64.startsWith("data:")) {
  const i = b64.indexOf("base64,");
  if (i > -1) b64 = b64.slice(i + "base64,".length);
}
const buffer = Buffer.isBuffer(file) ? file : Buffer.from(b64 || file, "base64");
console.log("[CHECK] filename=", filename, "buffer length=", buffer?.length);
if (!buffer?.length) return req.error(400, "Empty or invalid base64 file");

 

    • The field we will send via HTTP form-data needs to be binary ; therefore we convert the Base64 payload into a buffer .file

    • We return 400 (client error) for an empty or corrupt file .

    Create a job (submit with schemaId) We provide the selected schema and document type in , then submit the file to DocAI to start.
    options

const options = {
  clientId: "default",
  schemaId: chosen.id,
  documentType: chosen.documentType || "invoice",
};
console.log("[DocAI] submit options =", options);

const submitted = await submitJob(base, token, buffer, filename || "invoice.pdf", options);
const jobId = submitted?.id;
if (!jobId) throw new Error(`Job submit failed: ${JSON.stringify(submitted)}`);
console.log("[DocAI] jobId =", jobId);

    • schemaId: chosen.id‚Üí we use a dynamic schema id.

    • If successful, it returns a jobId; we use this ID to track the status of the job.

    • If filenamenot provided the default value is "invoice.pdf".

    Question the work and get results

    • The job runs in the background. We poll at intervals until the status is COMPLETED .

    • Once the process is complete, the extracted areas become available under .extraction

const result = await pollJob(base, token, jobId, 60000, 1500);
console.log("[DocAI] status DONE, extraction keys =", Object.keys(result?.extraction || {}));

    • pollJob(base, token, jobId, 60000, 1500)‚Üí 60 sec timeout / 1.5 sec interval .

    • Below and result.extractionyou get .headerFieldslineItems

    NOW LET'S GO TO TESTING:

    First, ...

cds watch --profile hybrid

Let's start our CAP project with the following command. (I started it this way because I chose HANA as the database .)

Sample Invoice PDF file:

 

Above is a sample PDF file we sent to the SAP Document AI service. The service automatically analyzes the invoice and extracts fields such as the invoice number, date, currency, supplier-customer information, and item information.

Testing with Postman:
Now that everything is ready on the backend, we can test the CAP action integrated with the Document AI service. To do this, use a REST client like Postman and send the following request:

  • Method: POST

    URL: http://localhost:4004/odata/v4/invoice/analyzeAndSave

    Body (JSON):

    • file name: Name of the PDF file to be uploaded

    • file: PDF file content in Base64 format

    In this answer:

    • The fields extracted by Document AI match exactly the action return types defined in service.cds.

    • These values ‚Äã‚Äãare also automatically saved to the HANA database in the background.

    In real projects, this setup isn't written manually. Instead, the Document AI service automatically connects to the CAP application via service binding . The application reads the necessary credentials directly from environment variables, and token acquisition is performed automatically in the background. This not only increases security (sensitive data like client secrets aren't visible in the code or repository) but also allows the application to run across different environments (dev, test, production) without additional configuration . During deployment, binding is provided via MTA or manifest files, and the application continues to run seamlessly with the same approach when deployed to production..envVCAP_SERVICES

 

Optional: Storing Raw Document AI JSON for Debugging:

 
 

In the Invoices entity of the schema , I defined a field called to store the original response returned by the Document AI service. This field is of type LargeString and holds all the header and line item data returned by Document AI in JSON format.RawJson

The purpose of this area:

  • Debug/Trace : Easily inspect the data returned by Document AI during development.

  • Extensibility : If I later want to add new fields or change the mapping structure, I can access the original source.

  • Data Traceability : Store raw invoice data so it can be reprocessed when necessary.

For example, when an invoice is processed, all the extraction data returned by Document AI is stored in this column. You can then open this data and clearly see which fields Document AI has recognized.

In this article, we explored how to enable SAP Document AI on SAP BTP and integrate it end-to-end with a CAP project. Each step‚Äîfrom creating the service instance and generating the service key to authenticating, defining CAP actions, and processing documents‚Äîrepresents a fundamental building block of a real-world backend automation setup.With this integration, you can now automatically process invoices or similar business documents without manual data entry. The extracted fields can be stored in your HANA database and then used for reporting, process automation, or analytics. This approach not only speeds up financial and operational workflows but also reduces human error and increases overall process reliability.In production environments, this setup is typically secured and automated through service binding, allowing applications to read credentials from environment variables without manual configuration. This ensures smooth operation across development, test, and production landscapes.As a next step, you can extend this backend integration with a SAP UI5 dashboard or management panel, enabling users to upload, view, validate, and approve invoices in real time. By doing so, you‚Äôll move from a simple technical integration to a fully functional end-to-end intelligent document processing solution.
